turns.content: what is the local model is
A "local model" generally refers to a machine learning model that runs directly on a user's device (like a laptop, phone, or server they control) rather than on a remote server.
A local model is a machine learning model that runs directly on your own device or infrastructure, as opposed to running on a remote server.

so local server is runing in machine that mesan we need to download or pull the trained model in our system first right then we can install a run time environment like ollama and similar to run that model locally rigth

A local model is a machine learning model that is executed on your own device or infrastructure, rather than on a remote server. This means the model and all the computations happen on your computer, phone, or a server within your own network.

wondering about the benefits of using local models versus remote servers, or how to set one up?
A local model is a machine learning model that runs directly on your own device or infrastructure, as opposed to running on a remote server.
A remote server, on the other hand, is a computer or a network of computers that is accessed over a network, typically the internet.
